meanings.definition: (verb) To form or flow with a series of small waves or undulations.
meanings.sent1: The pond was rippling gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The stream was rippling over the smooth stones.
meanings.sent3: The rippling water made the ducks playfully bob up and down.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rippled through the room, infecting everyone with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rippling sound of the wind through the leaves was soothing.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Having a series of small waves or undulations.
meanings.sent1: The rippling surface of the lake reflected the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The rippling fabric of her dress caught the eye of many admirers.
meanings.sent3: The rippling pattern on the wallpaper seemed to dance in the light.
meanings.sent4: Her rippling hair cascaded down her back like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The rippling hills in the distance looked like a painting.

meanings.sent1: The fisherman noticed a rippling in the water and cast his line.
meanings.sent2: The rippling of the flag caught the attention of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The rippling of the curtain made it seem like the room was breathing.
meanings.sent4: The rippling of the sand dunes created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The rippling of the music in the air added to the festive atmosphere.
